sentences.en: He wrote a libel against her character.
sentences.cn: 他写了篇文章来诽谤她的人格.

sentences.en: It can be difficult for public figures to win a libel case.
sentences.cn: 公众人物想打赢诽谤官司可能会很难。

sentences.en: It is unlikely that libel laws will be invoked.
Mr Warren sued him for libel over the remarks.
sentences.cn: 沃伦先生控告他散布诽谤性言论。

sentences.en: restrictions on press freedom, such as libel laws
sentences.cn: 诽谤法之类对新闻自由的限制

sentences.en: She had a libel action against the magazine pending.
sentences.cn: 她对该杂志提起的诽谤诉讼尚未判决。

sentences.en: That interview was an absolute libel on a honest man.
sentences.cn: 那篇采访报道完全是对一诚实人的诽谤.

sentences.en: The Board has banned the film on the grounds that it contravenes criminal libel laws.
sentences.cn: 委员会决定禁播这部电影，理由是它触犯了刑事诽谤法。

sentences.en: The film breached the criminal libel laws.
sentences.cn: 这部电影触犯了刑事诽谤法。

sentences.en: The jury awarded libel damages of ￡100,000.
sentences.cn: 陪审团判定诽谤赔偿费为10万英镑.

sentences.en: The newspaper which libelled him had already offered compensation.
sentences.cn: 那家诽谤他的报纸已经提出赔偿。

sentences.en: The onus of proof is reversed in libel actions and placed firmly on the defender.
sentences.cn: 在诽谤诉讼中，举证责任反过来由辩方全权承担。

sentences.en: The paper got clobbered with libel damages of half a million pounds.
sentences.cn: 这家报纸被罚以五十万英镑的诽谤损害赔偿金。

sentences.en: The ruling set a precedent for future libel cases.
sentences.cn: 这项裁决为今后的诽谤案提供了判例。

sentences.en: This photograph is a libel on her.
sentences.cn: 这张照片简直是诽谤〔把她照得太难看了〕.

sentences.en: This photograph is a libel on him.
sentences.cn: 这张相片有损他的形象((照得丑恶不堪)).

sentences.en: Warren sued him for libel over the remarks.
sentences.cn: 沃伦就此言论起诉他诽谤。
